member.name: T:plyBloxKitEditor.plyBlockFieldHandler
member.summary: A field handler is needed when you created custom types to use as fields in blocks. The handler will know how to make a copy of the field type and how to render it in the editor.

member.name: M:plyBloxKitEditor.plyBlockFieldHandler.GetCopy(System.Object)
member.summary: Override this. Should return a copy of the passed field (obj).

member.name: M:plyBloxKitEditor.plyBlockFieldHandler.OnFocus(System.Object,plyBloxKit.plyBlock)
member.summary: Override this. Called when the blocks was focused (selected) (clicked on). Good place to init some temp variables that might be used in DrawField()
member.param: The plyBlock that this field is used in.

member.name: M:plyBloxKitEditor.plyBlockFieldHandler.DrawField(System.Object@,plyBloxKit.plyBlock)
member.summary: Override this. Called by the editor when it wants the custom property/ field to be rendered. Should return TRUE if the value changed and should be saved.
member.param: The plyBlock that this field is used in.

member.name: F:plyBloxKitEditor.plyBloxGUI.blockIcons
member.summary: Add to this the icons that will be used in Blocks Default icons are: for variable types: local, global, temp for types defined in unity: animator, animation, audio, listener, transform, object, light
